articles.title: Scaling for growth: The keys to success
articles.summary: This article features insights from seasoned CEOs on the critical aspects of scaling for business growth, particularly focusing on reinvestment. Sherman Wright highlights barriers for minority-owned businesses and the importance of networking, information, and resources. Ann Ramakumaran and Robert Shibuya emphasize reinvesting in people, process, infrastructure, innovation, and supplier diversity as key drivers for becoming employers and suppliers of choice and doubling company size.

articles.title: Explained: India inclusion in JP Morgan EM Bond index, market impact & more
articles.summary: India's inclusion in the JP Morgan Emerging Market Bond Index (EMBI) will begin on June 28, 2024, gradually reaching a 10% weight by March 2025. This move is expected to attract significant foreign investment, estimated at least $30 billion, into Indian government bonds, leading to lower borrowing costs and a potentially stronger rupee. The article explains what bond market indices are, the specifics of India's inclusion, and its anticipated impact on Indian bond and equity markets.

articles.title: Bond market: Why foreign funds are flocking to India despite entry barriers
articles.summary: India's $1.3 trillion sovereign debt market is attracting significant foreign investment despite complex entry barriers like extensive documentation and intricate tax regulations. Foreign funds are buying bonds ahead of their inclusion in JPMorgan Chase & Co's emerging market debt index, anticipating substantial inflows. Despite operational challenges, the market's attraction is strong, with Goldman Sachs projecting an additional $30 billion in inflows over the next 10 months.

articles.title: NEA: Income Boosts Keep Boosting The Market Price (NYSE:NEA)
articles.summary: The Nuveen AMT-Free Quality Municipal Income Fund (NEA) has seen another income boost as the muni yield curve is upward sloping, offering an advantage over treasury bonds. The fund also has a notable discount to its Net Asset Value (NAV), which could attract value-oriented investors. The author, an investor focused on long-term quality and diversification, holds a long position in NEA.

articles.title: Capital Group launches seven active ETFs
articles.summary: Capital Group has launched seven new active ETFs, its largest launch to date, expanding its total active ETF offerings to 21. The new ETFs include fixed income and equity strategies, as well as the firm's first emerging markets ETF. Prior to this launch, Capital Group's ETF business managed $30.6bn in AUM, with the firm itself managing approximately $2.5tn globally.

articles.title: AI demand for data centers boosts Digital Realty’s prospects, stock wins upgrade
articles.summary: JPMorgan Chase analysts upgraded Digital Realty Trust Inc. from neutral to outperform, citing anticipated growth driven by increased demand for data center capacity from cloud and AI technologies. The analysts increased the price target for Digital Realty Trust (DLR) to $175 a share, leading to a 2.4% rise in the company’s stock. This upgrade highlights Digital Realty as a significant beneficiary of the expanding cloud and AI sectors.

articles.title: ETF Closures Drop While Openings Maintain Momentum
articles.summary: The number of ETF closures significantly declined last month compared to the previous year, with only ten funds shutting down, a steep drop from 51 in June 2023. Concurrently, new ETF openings continue at a strong pace, with 40 new funds launched last month, bringing the year-to-date total to 258, well ahead of the previous year's figures. This trend indicates sustained investor and advisor enthusiasm for ETFs due to their ease of trading and tax benefits, despite a potential saturation in some subsectors.

articles.title: Former PayPal exec leaves F5 board after landing JPMorgan Chase role
articles.summary: Sri Shivananda, formerly an executive at PayPal and a board member at F5, has resigned from F5's board after taking on a new role as CTO at JPMorgan Chase. Shivananda had been on F5's board since 2020, and F5 does not plan to name a replacement for his board seat.

articles.title: Webtoon Entertainment prices U.S. IPO at top of range to raise about $315 million
articles.summary: Webtoon Entertainment has priced its initial public offering (IPO) at the top of its indicated range, aiming to raise approximately $315 million. The online comics platform, majority-owned by South Korean tech giant Naver, priced 15 million shares at $21 each, valuing the company at $2.67 billion. Trading is expected to begin on the Nasdaq under the symbol "WBTN" on June 27.

articles.title: Members of Congress Buy and Sell Stocks. These ETFs Let You Invest Like Democrats or Republicans.
articles.summary: The article discusses the emergence of two new ETFs, the Unusual Whales Subversive Democratic Trading ETF (NANC) and the Unusual Whales Subversive Republican Trading ETF (CRUZ), which track the stock trades of members of Congress. It highlights that while these ETFs offer a way to invest like politicians, they are very young, small, and have high expense ratios compared to broader market ETFs. The author ultimately advises against investing in them due to these factors and the uncertainty of politicians' investing prowess.

articles.title: BlackRock shareholders vote, keep directors in place in Saba saga
articles.summary: BlackRock shareholders have voted to keep the asset manager's directors in place and retain it as manager for four of its closed-end funds, successfully fending off a challenge from hedge fund manager Boaz Weinstein's Saba Capital Management. This marks the second consecutive year Saba has failed to convince shareholders to replace BlackRock directors or fire the fund manager across the funds, despite Saba's arguments over poor performance and discounts to underlying assets. Saba, which sought to elect its own nominees and fire BlackRock as manager, remains committed to holding BlackRock accountable in court.

articles.title: DoubleDragon rates retail bond offering at an 'auspicious' 8.008%
articles.summary: DoubleDragon Corporation has priced its retail bond offering at an "auspicious" 8.008% per annum, with founder Edgar "Injap" Sia II highlighting the favorable coupon rate and accessibility for a wide range of investors. The company's total equity is expected to exceed P100 billion this year, and its Hotel101 brand is being exported internationally, anticipating significant US Dollar inflow to the Philippine economy. DoubleDragon's consolidated net income for 2023 increased by 23.25% to P15.93 billion, and total assets rose to P181.24 billion.

articles.title: Retirement Industry People Moves
articles.summary: This article details several significant personnel changes within the retirement industry. Key moves include Jose Minaya joining BNY Mellon as global head of investments and wealth, Allison Itami becoming an employee benefits partner at Lathrop GPM, Mike Maxwell being named head of strategic accounts for Pentegra Retirement Services, Alvis Munari's appointment as chief product officer at MSCI, and Christopher McGlynn's promotion at Pacific Life. These appointments reflect strategic growth and leadership changes across various financial and legal firms.

articles.title: BlackRock's Preqin deal prompts lower outlook at Moody's
articles.summary: Moody's Corp. has lowered its outlook on BlackRock to negative from stable following the asset manager's recent acquisitions, including the $3.2 billion purchase of Preqin and the $12.5 billion acquisition of Global Infrastructure Partners. The ratings company voiced concerns over BlackRock's increased debt and leverage ratios due to these deals. While acknowledging potential revenue synergies from Preqin and BlackRock's strong acquisition record, Moody's is watchful of the strain on management resources.

articles.title: South Korea-Owned Webtoon Launches Its Nasdaq IPO
articles.summary: Webtoon Entertainment, a South Korea-owned serial comics platform, launched its Nasdaq IPO, ringing the bell and raising a US$315 million valuation on its opening day. The company's shares opened at US$21, the top of its target range, trading under the symbol WBTN. Webtoon, which now classifies itself as the parent company of Wattpad, reported impressive user and content figures, with CEO Junkoo Kim emphasizing its role in "democratizing content creation and publication."
